page.title: 02Cockayne Hatley Church.
page.content: The church is dedicated to St. John the Baptist and was once the church belonging to the old manor but it is now the parish church. It is built in the Decorated Style of English Church of local sandstone infilled with rubble. Although its exterior is not unusual its interior decorations certainly are, and make it a unique church since{all}its woodwork, apart from some modern benches added in the last two years, is not only foreign but of Roman Catholic origin. A restoration was undertaken in 1806 by the Reverend Henry Cockayne Cust and the entire interior of the church was redecorated with beautifully carved woodwork from Catholic Monastries and churches in the Low Countries. Unfortunately the money ran out before an organ could be built.
